intro: Rhynchospora solitaria, commonly known as the solitary spike-rush, is a flowering plant in the family Cyperaceae. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in wetlands and moist soils, often in areas with standing water. The plant produces a single, slender spike of small, pale brown flowers, which are usually wind-pollinated. Its leaves are grass-like, linear, and arranged in a dense, cylindrical cluster around the stem. Rhynchospora solitaria is often found in northern regions of North America and is an important component of wetland ecosystems.
